Title: Write Creative Sentences
Description: We'll give you a list of actions (plus ideas for who is doing the action).  You write a sentence where the action is done in a certain way / style.  Possible bonus for creativity.
Keywords: creative write sentence transitivity nouns verbs writing generation bonus reward
instructions:
• We'll show you an action (represented by a video), things that can do the action, and some things the action can be done to, and you'll write two sentences combining them together.
  • We're interested in how the concept of movement is expressed. One sentence you write will be where the thing doing the action moves while performing the action. The other sentence will be where the thing doing the action does not move while performing the action.
  • The suggested things that can do the action or that can have the action done to them are ideas to get your creative juices flowing. They came from other people on Mechanical Turk, so some of them might not make sense (nobody's perfect); if so, please ignore them. You don't have to use the suggested things that can do the action or things that the action can be done to. The only requirement is that you use a form of the specified action and to have the sentence reflect that movement is (or is not) happening.
  • There are a number of different reasons why sentences might not have movement. The thing doing the action might not have a physical presence or the "action" is actually a thought or a state which doesn't require any movement. Here are some sentences where movement is not taking place.
    • push: I pushed myself to finish the project.
    • jumped: The corporation jumped to a silly conclusion.
    • like: John likes beer.
  • Sentences where movement happens clearly have someone or something performing a physical action. For example:
    • push: Ed pushed his poor sister into the lake.
    • jumped: Sue jumped out of an airplane.
    • wash: Joe washed my car in the driveway this morning.
  • It might not be possible to write a sentence with the action and properties as given. If so, click the box that says "it's not possible to write such a sentence."
  • Note that we're interested in what happens with the action happens, not what happens before or after. It's okay to say that it's impossible to write sentences; however, if you can't write a sentence with motion, you should be able to write one without (and the other way around).
  • Please make sure your sentences make sense and that you try to answer all of the questions. Incomplete or incoherent responses will be rejected.
  • We'll pay a bonus for particularly creative sentences (something that makes sense and wouldn't look out of place in a book or newspaper).
